div.p: For all COVID-19 closing announcements including distant learning information, please click on the "parent information" link on the website
For information regarding frequently asked questions from the state department, please click the following link
All school closing information will be announced on Lawton and Oklahoma City news channels, School Messenger, and on the school website.

Parents: If your child is going to be absent, in order to have an excused absence, you must call the secretary of your child's building no later than 8:00 of the morning your child returns to school, or provide a doctor's note explaining the absence at the time your child returns!
You can check your child's grades or make cafeteria payments online, you should have a login to access the website, if you do not, please check with the building secretaries.
All juniors enrolled at Empire High School in April of 2020 will be given the ACT assessment as their state assessment.
Per the OKSDE, all Oklahoma schools will be closed until April 6th, for more information please check the parent information page on this website.

During the shut down from March 23rd to April 3rd, we will be providing meals to students. These meals will be "Grab and Go" available from 9:00am-9:30am in the cafeteria and at Cameron University parking lot on Bois D'arc. For more information please call the office at 580-252-5392.
Prom has been rescheduled: New date is April 25th!
If any elementary students sold Cookie Dough it will be available to pick up on Wednesday, March 25th from 12:00-3:00pm in the library.
